articles.headline: Arrests Sow Mistrust Inside a Clan of Hackers
articles.snippet: Law enforcement officials worldwide are coordinating efforts against Anonymous.
articles.abstract: Law enforcement officials worldwide are coordinating efforts against Anonymous.
articles.lead_paragraph: For months, The Real Sabu, as he called himself on Twitter, boasted, cursed and egged on his followers to take part in computer attacks against private companies and government agencies worldwide.

articles.headline: Stanford Convicted by Jury in $7 Billion Ponzi Scheme
articles.snippet: R. Allen Stanford, a Texas financier, was found guilty on 13 out of 14 fraud counts in a scheme that lasted more than two decades.
articles.abstract: R. Allen Stanford, a Texas financier, was found guilty on 13 out of 14 fraud counts in a scheme that lasted more than two decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — A federal jury on Tuesday convicted R. Allen Stanford, a Texas financier, on 13 out of 14 counts of fraud in connection with a worldwide scheme that lasted more than two decades and involved more than $7 billion in investments.

articles.headline: An Architect of a Deal Sees Greece as a Model
articles.snippet: Mitu Gulati, a Duke law professor, who with Lee Buchheit, a New York lawyer, developed the blueprint for Greece’s bond write-off, says that similar deals would help other indebted countries.
articles.abstract: Mitu Gulati, a Duke law professor, who with Lee Buchheit, a New York lawyer, developed the blueprint for Greece’s bond write-off, says that similar deals would help other indebted countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADRID — Now that Greece is close to completing the largest bond write-off on record, should other debt-plagued nations in Europe follow its lead?

articles.headline: Web Sites Shine Light on Petty Bribery Worldwide
articles.snippet: I Paid a Bribe, a site in India, is spawning a movement of corruption-exposing sites and in turn is vexing bribe-seeking bureaucrats all around the globe.
articles.abstract: I Paid a Bribe, a site in India, is spawning a movement of corruption-exposing sites and in turn is vexing bribe-seeking bureaucrats all around the globe.
articles.lead_paragraph: The cost of claiming a legitimate income tax refund in Hyderabad, India? 10,000 rupees.

articles.headline: Romney Appears the Ohio Winner; Santorum Strong
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney apparently pulled off a narrow victory over Rick Santorum in Ohio. But Mr. Santorum scored victories elsewhere, competing with Mr. Romney’s achievement of collecting the most delegates.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney apparently pulled off a narrow victory over Rick Santorum in Ohio. But Mr. Santorum scored victories elsewhere, competing with Mr. Romney’s achievement of collecting the most delegates.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney appeared to pull off a narrow victory in Ohio on Super Tuesday but lost several other states to Rick Santorum, a split verdict that overshadowed Mr. Romney’s claim of collecting the most delegates and all but ensured another round of intense infighting on the road to the Republican presidential nomination.

articles.headline: Dividends Emerge in Pressing Apple Over Working Conditions in China
articles.snippet: Is it time to boycott Apple? Sweatshop opposition in the past offers limited hope, but consumer pressure has already led Apple to make some big changes.
articles.abstract: Is it time to boycott Apple? Sweatshop opposition in the past offers limited hope, but consumer pressure has already led Apple to make some big changes.
articles.lead_paragraph: The American sweatshop opposition movement was born the day we discovered how our Nikes were stitched together. Two decades later, we are discovering how our cherished iPhones are made, giving Apple a “Nike moment” of its own.

articles.headline: Obama Scolds G.O.P. Critics of Iran Policy
articles.snippet: The president deplored the “casualness” with which many Republicans have called for war to solve the crisis over Iran’s nuclear program, and challenged his critics to make their case to voters.
articles.abstract: The president deplored the “casualness” with which many Republicans have called for war to solve the crisis over Iran’s nuclear program, and challenged his critics to make their case to voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama on Tuesday forcefully rebuked Republicans on the presidential campaign trail and in Congress for “beating the drums of war” in criticizing his efforts to find a diplomatic solution to the crisis over Iran’s nuclear program, underscoring how squarely the national security issue had entered the election-year debate.
articles.byline: By Jackie Calmes and Mark Landler

articles.headline: With No Knockout Punch, a Bruising Battle Plods On
articles.snippet: With what appeared to be only a slim victory in Ohio, the most coveted primary of Super Tuesday, Mitt Romney must decide what is needed to repair his candidacy.
articles.abstract: With what appeared to be only a slim victory in Ohio, the most coveted primary of Super Tuesday, Mitt Romney must decide what is needed to repair his candidacy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney won the delegates, but not necessarily the argument.
